insights.recommendation: Replace NoOpPasswordEncoder with BCryptPasswordEncoder to securely hash passwords. This prevents storing passwords in plaintext, which exposes credentials to potential compromise.
Remove .csrf(csrf -> csrf.disable()) and retain Spring Security's default CSRF protection. Disabling CSRF leaves the application vulnerable to cross-site request forgery attacks.
Implement more granular access controls. Review and restrict permitAll() endpoints to only essential resources, reducing the attack surface.
